data.title: Performing Artistes
meta_keywords: Performing Artistes  Artistes Index & Speaker Index for Corporate Event Speakers and Business Speakers.
data.meta_description: Performing Artistes  Artistes Index & Speaker Index for Corporate Event Speakers and Business Speakers.
data.text:
Playing the biggest Dance, Chart and R&B classics from the last 30 years, ROYAL are one of the UK’s freshest and most unique DJ Live acts.

Royal

A world-class showband crammed full of charisma, charm and effortless talent, The Revue have honed their trade performing for the most discerning audiences at illustrious venues and luxury events across the world.

The Revue

Ember Trio are a New-Age Classical crossover act consisting of 2 cellos and a violin. They combine a unique blend of classical and contemporary production elements which have elevated them to become Europe’s most successful classical crossover string trio.

Ember Trio

Wandering Soul are a London based quartet roaming band, immersing and encouraging everyone to sing and dance as if they were part of the band!

Wandering Soul

Rob and Paul founded the brand Gandys in order to support their Orphans for Orphans foundation after their parents were killed in the devastating Tsunami that hit Sri Lanka. For corporate events their unique story will keep your audience spellbound.

The Gandy Brothers

The Tempest Two is made up of friends James Whittle & Tom Caulfield. In 2015, the pair boarded a 7 metre rowing boat, and rowed 3000 miles across the Atlantic Ocean, totally unaided, having never rowed or sailed before. 54 days later, with a lifetime of stories, they landed in Barbados. Since then, the pair left their jobs in London to become full-time adventurers and speakers.

The Tempest Two

Devin Joseph Jordan "Dev" Griffin is a British actor, radio presenter and DJ who is most commonly known for presenting the weekend breakfast show on BBC Radio 1.He currently presents a weekend show on Heart from 12-4.

Dev

Lee Ridley AKA Lost Voice Guy may not be able to talk, but he definitely has something to say, and his comedy will leave you speechless!

Lost Voice Guy

Mindreading double-act DNA took the world by storm when they appeared on Britain’s Got Talent Series 11 (2017) with their incredible telepathic ability known as "The Gift". Wowing the judges, live audience and viewers at home, the duo went on to reach the finals of the hit TV talent show. Able to put on a thrilling and dynamic stage show and perform sensational close up entertainment, UK Mindreading Duo DNA will astound the most sceptical of audiences with their incredible ability.

DNA
